Record Class Position

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.gr15.pacman.model.Position
Record Components:
x - the horizontal coordinate (column)
y - the vertical coordinate (row)
public record Position(int x, int y) extends Record
Represents a coordinate (x, y) on a 2D grid. Used to denote positions on the game board for entities such as Pacman and ghosts. This record provides utility methods for movement, bounds checking, distance calculation, neighboring positions.

  • Method Details

    • offset

      public Position offset(Entity.Direction dir)
      Returns a new Position offset from this one in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction to offset by (must not be null)
      Returns:
      a new position one tile in the given direction
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if dir is null

    • inBounds

      public <T> boolean inBounds(T[][] board)
      Checks if this position is within the bounds of the provided 2D board.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the datatype of the the 2d array.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to check against (must not be null)
      Returns:
      true if the position is within the board, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if board is null

    • distance

      public double distance(Position other)
      Calculates the Euclidean distance from this position to another.
      Parameters:
      other - the other position to compare to (must not be null)
      Returns:
      the straight-line distance between this position and the other
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if other is null

    • neighbors

      public List<Position> neighbors()
      Returns a list of the four neighbor positions (up, down, left, right). Diagonal neighbors are not included.
      Returns:
      a list of adjacent positions surrounding this one

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
